citation.article-title: Mycoplasma lagogenitalium sp. nov., from the preputial smegma of Afghan pikas (Ochotona rufescens rufescens).

p.s: Description of Mycoplasma lagogenitalium sp. nov.
Mycoplasma lagogenitalium (la. go. ge. ni. ta'. li. um;lagos, Gr. masc. n., hare; genitalium, L. plur. neutr. gen., of hare's genitals)
Cells lack true cell walls and are coccoid.
Colonies on solid medium usually have a typical fried-egg appearance.
Arginine and urea are not hydrolyzed.
Films or spots are not produced.
Lyses sheep erythrocytes but does not adsorb sheep, rabbit, or horse erythrocytes.
Cholesterol or serum is required for growth.
The G+C content of the DNA is 23 ± 1.0 mol%.
Isolated from the preputial smegma of Afghan pikas (Ochotona rufescens rufescens).
